sections.heading: Overview
content:
Robert H. Schneider, MD, is director of the Center for Health and Aging
Studies in Fairfield, IA, and a professor of physiology and Maharishi Ayurveda.
He has developed a program of clinical research on aging and the promotion of
health, including the prevention of heart disease. Schneider is currently
principal investigator on three major grants totaling $2.3 million, two of
which are funded by the National Institutes of Health and are being used to
investigate stress reduction in elderly African-Americans with hypertension and
heart disease. The third grant is funded by the Retirement Research Foundation,
for the first large-scale controlled study of Maharishi Ayurveda programs and
health promotion in the elderly. Schneider's hypertension study, published in
the American Heart Association's journal Hypertension, found that the
Transcendental Meditation technique produced blood pressure reductions equal to
those commonly found with medication. The National Institutes of Health awarded
$1.4 million for a follow-up study, now underway at the West Oakland Health
Center in California.
